### how to use

```tsx
const columns = [
  {
    label: 'Receive Time',
    name: 'receiveTime',
    options: [
      {
        label: 'Ascending',
        key: 'test-id1',
        value: 1,
      },
      {
        label: 'Descending',
        key: 'test-id2',
        value: -1,
      },
    ],
  },
  {
    label: 'Campaign Start Time',
    name: 'startTime',
    options: [
      {
        label: 'Newest to oldest',
        key: 'test-id3',
        value: 1,
      },
      {
        label: 'Oldest to newest',
        key: 'test-id4',
        value: -1,
      },
    ],
  },
];

const defaultSortValues = {
  receiveTime: {
    value: 1,
    label: 'Receive Time',
  },
};

export const YourComponent: React.FunctionComponent<Props> = (props) => {
  const [sortData, setSortData] = useState(defaultSortValues);
  const onClose = () => {};
  const onSortConfirm = (selectedValue) => {
    setSortData(selectedValue); // save current state
    // do your rest sorting task
  };
  const handlePressSort = () => {
    PruModalService.open(
      <SortModal
        modalTitle="Sorting"
        onClose={onClose}
        columns={columns}
        defaultValues={defaultSortValues}
        selectedValues={sortData}
        onConfirm={onSortConfirm}
      />,
    );
  };
  return null;
};
```
